subject: Critical Thinking
title: False Dilemma: Only Two Choices?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: False Dilemma: Only Two Choices?.

hook.text: 'You're either with us or against us.' Really? There's no middle ground, no third option, no nuance at all?

buildup.text: False dilemma: presenting only two options when more exist.

discovery.text: Also called 'black-or-white thinking.' Real issues almost always have more than two possible positions.

twist.text: Politicians love this: 'Either we cut taxes or the economy collapses.' Both could be wrong. A third path could exist.

climax.text: The fix: whenever someone presents two options, ask 'What are options three, four, and five?'

punchline.text: Life isn't multiple choice with only two answers.

quiz.question: What is a false dilemma?
options: A difficult choice between two real options
Presenting only two options when more exist
